Description: Madonna della Scodella; the Virgin Mary sits on the ground in the bottom right, holding a bowl (scodella) in her left hand; the young Jesus is on Mary's lap, holding Joseph's left hand; Joseph, stading on the left, handing a branch of palm tree to angels hovering above among clouds; two further figures and a donkey visible in the background; printed in reverse; sheet cut in irregular shape Etching
Curator's comments: Print after Correggio's altarpiece, originally in the church of the Santo Sepolcro in Parma, removed thence in 1796, now in the Galleria Nazionale, Parma. A scene from the journey in Egypt based on the apocryphal gospel of Pseudo-Matthew. See Gould, 1976, p. 263-265. Printed in reverse. The printmaker is identified as an otherwise unknown "Francesco Dus (active XVIIc)" by Mussini 'Correggio Tradotto', 1995, p. 211. Pungileoni, 1821, vol. 3, p. 96 gives "Ernesto du D." See also 1837,0408.274
Subjects: return of the holy family from egypt
Associated places: Associated with: Parma (city) (Church of Santo Sepolcro)
Acquisition notes: From Richard Ford's collection of prints after Correggio (1837,0408.14 to 669), purchased from him through Colnaghi's, for £250.
